definition: to fit/suitable/proper/just (now)/comfortable/well/to go/to follow or pursue

sentences.english: But if it remains unchecked, when they reach the marriage age, problems will occur.
sentences.chinese: 但是如果不采取措施，到适婚年龄时，问题就会出现。

sentences.english: Yet, at 35, she is well past Taiwan's unspoken marriage deadline.
sentences.chinese: 但是，35岁的她早已超出台湾默认的适婚年龄。

sentences.english: But you’ve forgotten that many years have passed since you’ve first achieved employment and you’re getting to that marrying age.
sentences.chinese: 但是你忘了你已经工作这么多年，快到适婚年龄了。

sentences.english: Have you got a son or daughter that you'd like to get married?
sentences.chinese: 你有适婚年龄的儿子或女儿吗？

sentences.english: I think that marriageable age is silly.
sentences.chinese: 我认为适婚年龄非常愚蠢。

definition: length of married life/marriageable age/actual marrying age
young people in their late 20s or older who are still unmarried
"leftover woman" (successful career woman who has remained single)
older (than average in a group, at school, for marriage etc)
to seek a marriage partner/looking for a mate
blind date/arranged interview to evaluate a proposed marriage partner (Taiwan pr. [xiang4 qin1])/to be deeply attached to each other
to get married and have kids/to start a family
to settle down and get married (of a man)/to become a recognized expert
